article.headline: Just Eat Takeaway.com loss widens on rising costs
article.body: Just Eat Takeaway.com NV on Wednesday reported a widened pretax loss for the first half of the year as it booked higher costs, and said the integration with Just Eat is on track and progressing well. The food delivery company--which was formed through the merger of Just Eat and Takeaway.com--said that it has started an "aggressive investment program" and will invest in the U.K., Canada, Australia, Italy, Spain, France and several other ex-Just Eat markets. For the half year ended June 30 the company made a loss before tax of 121 million euros ($142.1 million), compared with a loss of EUR7 million for the comparable period last year. Revenue for the period rose to EUR1.03 billion, from EUR715 million. The company processed 257 million orders in the first half of the year, 32% more than the first half of 2019, driven by strong growth in the second quarter as coronavirus-related lockdowns stopped customers getting out. Write to Ian Walker at ian.walker@wsj.com
